problem_text:
An element g of a (relatively) free group Fr(M) of rank r of a variety M is said to be primitive if it can be included in a basis of Fr(M).
a) Do there exist a group Fr(M) and a non-primitive element h ∈ Fr(M) such that for some monomorphism α of Fr(M) the element α(h) is primitive?
b) Do there exist a group Fr(M) and a non-primitive element h ∈ Fr(M) such that for some n > r the element h is primitive in Fn(M)?
E. I. Timoshenko
